metadata.synopsis: Nested dialog used for Karlach upgrades in Dammon's default dialogues.
metadata.how_to_trigger: With an infernal metal in the party inventory speak with Dammon and don't give it to him during the OM. Then speak with him and give it.

107.speaker: Dammon
107.text: Mm. The weight of it. And that blaze of chaos. Can't imagine this where my heart should be. Must be quite the experience.

20.speaker: Dammon
20.text: Give me just a moment... and I think...
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)InternalNodeContext: This branch is also in DEN_ForgingOfTheHeart_OM_KArlach_COM (N92)

121.speaker: Dammon
121.text: There. You'll have to install it, I'm afraid. I don't think there are thick enough gloves in all the realms to protect from that kind of heat.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: That feels... good. I'm still burning hot as Hell's hole, but I feel less... changeable. Cheers, mate.

118.speaker: Dammon
118.text: Pleasure. And as for the heat, I haven't got any solutions now, but I'm not giving up. Could be if the combustion chamber had its own insulation, or if we had some kind of enchanted coolant...

17.speaker: Dammon
17.text: Find me again in Baldur's Gate. If I'm worth my salt, I'll have figured something out by then.

2.speaker: Dammon
2.text: Let me sleep on it. I just might be able to work something out.

61.speaker: Dammon
61.text: Hopefully the next time I see you, I'll have something promising to report. I'll need more infernal iron either way, though, so keep your eyes open. Take care.

13.speaker: Dammon
13.text: Mm. The weight of it. And that blaze of chaos. Can't imagine this where my heart should be. Must be quite the experience.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach hands off the metal to Dammon (off screen), and he takes it (off screen - this can stay bronze). He holds it, enjoying the power of it.InternalNodeContext: This branch is also in DEN_ForgingOfTheHeart_OM_KArlach_COM (N27)

122.speaker: Karlach
122.text: I'm still burning just as hot as ever.

55.speaker: Dammon
55.text: I can tune it up, but whether I can stop it from burning out is... up to the gods. That thing just wasn't meant to last in the Material Plane.

12.speaker: Dammon
12.text: Then again, I do love a challenge. Could be if the combustion chamber had its own insulation, or if the spark plug had a dampener... I'll give it some thought.

111.speaker: Dammon
111.text: You look good, too. Enjoy it - after spending time in Avernus, I know better than most that you deserve a good turn.

41.speaker: Dammon
41.text: That engine wasn't meant for this realm, though. And I'm not sure how much longer it's going to last, burning that hot.

27.speaker: Dammon
27.text: Well - all right. This shouldn't take long.
27.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach hands off the metal to Dammon (off screen), and he takes it (off screen - this can stay bronze).

He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)NodeContext: A little wary/ sad, because he has bad news for Karlach.

6.speaker: Dammon
6.text: Same as last time - you'll need to install it yourself. But this should do the trick.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.

10.speaker: Dammon
10.text: Only one way to find out.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: She inclines her head toward your hand and chokes up a little.NodeContext: Choking up

65.speaker: Karlach
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: She inclines her head toward your hand and chokes up a little.NodeContext: Choking up

26.speaker: Karlach
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hugs you strongly, her face buried in your neck as she begins to cry.NodeContext: Overwhelmed with emotion

35.speaker: Karlach
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hugs you strongly, her face buried in your neck as she begins to cry.NodeContext: Overwhelmed with emotion

115.speaker: Karlach
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and karlach kiss passionately. NodeContext: When she speaks (after the kiss) she has tears in her eyes and his verklempt

101.speaker: Karlach
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and karlach kiss passionately. NodeContext: When she speaks (after the kiss) she has tears in her eyes and his verklempt

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Can we go to bed now?
67.context:
NodeContext: Still crying but kinda making herself laugh too.
NOTE TO DIRECTOR:
We had to change the text of this line for gameplay reasons, but we really loved the original take and would like to reference it for hte re-record.
For reference, the original line's  UUID: h8605b090gbf19g43e5gb56fgaea68974604d

"Can we go to camp now?"

131.speaker: Dammon
131.text: Hold on, Karlach. There's something I need to tell you.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: Ignot. Look at that. No fire.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reaches out and grasps the player's shoulder.NodeContext: Good-humored. She's calling you a weirdo. 'IG-not'

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: I can't believe it. Thank you, Dammon. Thank you so much.

49.speaker: Dammon
49.text: It's the least I could do.

94.speaker: Dammon
94.text: Before you go - there's something I need to tell you.

125.speaker: Dammon
125.text: That engine of yours - it's contained for the moment, but it's just too hot to exist here in the material plane indefinitely.

106.speaker: Dammon
106.text: I know you know that, but the thing is, there's a cure.

5.speaker: Dammon
5.text: I wasn't making any headway with the mechanics - none at all. The environment here is just too cold to sustain metals like the ones inside you.

120.speaker: Dammon
120.text: You have to return to Avernus - for good - or this thing is going to burn you up from the inside out. And sooner than you think.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: The minute I set foot back in Avernus, Zariel will force me back into service. I'm not doing her bidding again. I'd rather die.

44.speaker: Dammon
44.text: I get that. But don't rule it out. The world just might be better with you in it - even in Avernus.

79.speaker: Dammon
79.text: I won't stop trying to figure out a cure, but... at this point, I think we all have to face the inevitable.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: Yeah. Apart from the doom and gloom, you've given me more than I could ever hope to repay.

73.speaker: Dammon
73.text: It's been my pleasure. Good luck - both of you. Look after yourself, all right?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: We'll have to make the inevitable evitable, then.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: First things first. Karlach, you have touch back. We ought to celebrate that.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: Right? All this doom and gloom. I have something far more exciting on my mind than this bloody tin box.
50.context: NodeContext: A little uncertain. She means what she's saying but also papering over the weight of what she's just heard.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: Thanks, Dammon. Really. You've given me more than I could ever repay.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Ignot. Look at that. No fire.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reaches out and grasps the player's shoulder.NodeContext: Good-humored. She's calling you a weirdo. 'IG-not'

31.speaker: Dammon
31.text: Damn. I'm good. And you - you're very touchable.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Thank you, Dammon. I can't tell you what this means to me.

102.speaker: Dammon
102.text: My pleasure. Before you go - there's something I need to tell you.

64.speaker: Dammon
64.text: That engine of yours - it's contained for the moment, but it's just too hot to exist here in the material plane indefinitely.

98.speaker: Dammon
98.text: I know you know that, but the thing is, there's a cure.

25.speaker: Dammon
25.text: I wasn't making any headway with the mechanics - none at all. The environment here is just too cold to sustain metals like the ones inside you.

59.speaker: Dammon
59.text: You have to return to Avernus - for good - or this thing is going to burn you up from the inside out. And sooner than you think.

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: Isn't there anything you can do?

75.speaker: Dammon
75.text: I can't say. I don't think anyone can. But when it's coming... you'll know.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: I don't know what to say.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: The minute I set foot back in Avernus, Zariel will force me back into service. I'm not doing her bidding again. I'd rather die.

9.speaker: Dammon
9.text: I get that. But don't rule it out. The world just might be better with you in it - even in Avernus.

40.speaker: Dammon
40.text: I won't stop trying to figure out a cure, but... at this point, I think I might be beaten.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: That isn't true. Anything can be beaten.

86.speaker: Dammon
86.text: I hope you're right, and I hope I'm wrong.

108.speaker: Dammon
108.text: Good luck, Karlach. Look after yourself, all right?

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: Say nothing. You're still trying to process what you've heard.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: You're going to let a bit of iron beat you?!

97.speaker: Dammon
97.text: It's not any old iron, Karlach. This stuff belongs in the Hells, and unless it's taken back there, it's going to blow. No amount of tinkering is going to change that.

3.speaker: Dammon
3.text: I wish it could. I really, really do. Look after yourself, all right?

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: ...I am sorry, Karlach. Truly I am. But come - it is not a decision you must make this moment.
8.context: NodeContext: Just heard that Karlach cannot be cured and will have to return to Avernus or die. Not trying to soften the blow or lie to her - just expressisng genuine sympathy and trying to help her focus on the path forward.

18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
18.text: We are all dust or ash in the end. Make your enemies burn while your heart still beats, and it will be a good life, no matter how brief.
18.context: NodeContext: slightly mournful but pragmatic - this is Minthara's idea of a pep talk for a terminally ill companion. Delivered sincerely.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: A warrior of your talents does not need looking after. You only need the next battle, then the next, then the next.

70.speaker: Wyll
70.text: Together, we are mightier than even the fires of Avernus. We will overcome, Karlach - I promise you.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: Come on, Karlach. There's got to be more to this - some other way.

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: An all-too-familiar tale. I refuse to believe we cannot alter the ending.
87.context: NodeContext: Determination (thinking of the parallels between Karlach's dilemma and his own)

123.speaker: Minsc
123.text: So bright a warrior needs no looking after. But... Boo and I will have her back, just in case.
123.context: NodeContext: Bravado for a fellow warrior he respects - second line a gentler affirmation that she'll be missed when she's gone

130.speaker: Halsin
130.text: Her will is strong - even now, she defies the bounds of the material plane. She will prevail.

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: Pause. Is he flirting with you?

72.speaker: Dammon
72.text: Ahem - look, Karlach, there's something I need to tell you.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: Take your leave - you have someone you really want to touch.

19.speaker: Dammon
19.text: Hold on, Karlach. There's something I need to tell you.

110.speaker: Dammon
110.text: Well - all right. This shouldn't take long.
110.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach hands off the metal to Dammon (off screen), and he takes it (off screen - this can stay bronze).

He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)NodeContext: A little wary/ sad, because he has bad news for Karlach.

14.speaker: Dammon
14.text: Same as last time - you'll need to install it yourself. But this should do the trick.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.

48.speaker: Dammon
48.text: Go on. Give us your hand.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon holds up his hand. Karlach holds hers up to his, their palms touching.

37.speaker: Dammon
37.text: Damn. I'm good. And you - you're very touchable.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Still haven't lost it, after all these years. Thanks, Dammon.

42.speaker: Dammon
42.text: Before you go - there's something I need to tell you.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: The minute I set foot back in Avernus, Zariel will force me back into service. I'm not doing her bidding again. I'd rather die.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Nothing is inevitable. Especially not this.

90.speaker: Dammon
90.text: Mm. The weight of it. And that blaze of chaos. Can't imagine this where my heart should be. Must be quite the experience.

83.speaker: Dammon
83.text: Give me just a moment... and I think...
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)InternalNodeContext: This branch is also in DEN_ForgingOfTheHeart_OM_KArlach_COM (N92)

51.speaker: Dammon
51.text: There. You'll have to install it, I'm afraid. I don't think there are thick enough gloves in all the realms to protect from that kind of heat.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: That feels... good. I'm still burning hot as Hell's hole, but I feel less... changeable. Cheers, mate.

119.speaker: Dammon
119.text: Pleasure. And as for the heat, I haven't got any solutions now, but I'm not giving up. Could be if the combustion chamber had its own insulation, or if we had some kind of enchanted coolant...

4.speaker: Dammon
4.text: Find me again in Baldur's Gate. If I'm worth my salt, I'll have figured something out by then.

129.speaker: Dammon
129.text: Take care, Karlach. And hopefully the next time I see you, I'll have something promising to report. Pocket any infernal iron you find along the way, hmm?

54.speaker: Dammon
54.text: Let me sleep on it. I just might be able to work something out.

109.speaker: Dammon
109.text: Hopefully the next time I see you, I'll have something promising to report. I'll need more infernal iron either way, though, so keep your eyes open. Take care.
